title: Kavinda de Zoysa appointed chairman of Bank of Ceylon
byline: Mr. Kavinda de Zoysa has been appointed as the new Chairman of the Bank of Ceylon (BOC), Sri Lanka’s leading state-owned financial institution.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers  or thundershowers will occur at several places in Central, Sabaragamuwa, Uva, Southern and Western provinces during the evening or night.

title: Trump, Harris notch first statewide wins as polls close in US presidential race
byline: Republican Donald Trump won 15 states in Tuesday’s U.S. presidential election while Democrat Kamala Harris captured seven states and Washington, D.C., Edison Research projected, but the contest remained undecided with critical battleground states unlikely to be called for hours or even days.

title: Two dead after vehicle swept away by strong currents at Thummodara Canal
byline: A vehicle attempting to cross the Thummodara Canal on the Eswatta Manakada Road in the Kosgama police division was swept away by strong water currents last evening.

title: Sri Lanka relaxes restrictions on animal transport over African swine fever
byline: Sri Lanka’s Department of Animal Production and Health has announced steps to issue a new Gazette notification, relaxing some of the restrictions imposed earlier due to the African swine fever outbreak.

title: Sri Lankan migrants stranded on Diego Garcia offered move to UK – report
byline: Migrants stranded for years on the remote Indian Ocean island of Diego Garcia will be offered the right to come to the UK, under a government proposal.

title: EC summons officials to discuss preparations for Parliamentary Election
byline: District Returning Officers and Assistant Election Commissioners have been summoned to the Election Commission today (06) to discuss preparations for the upcoming parliamentary election.

title: Businessman found dead under suspicious circumstances in Polonnaruwa
byline: A businessman has reportedly been found dead under suspicious circumstances in the Muslim Colony area of the Polonnaruwa police division.

title: Govt. eases restriction on social events at Galle Face Green
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has decided to allow the use of the Galle Face Green for miscellaneous social activities.

title: China’s fabric grant for 2025 school uniforms receives approval
byline: The People’s Republic of China has agreed to provide the total amount of around 11.82 million meters of fabric required to be provided for schoolchildren as uniform materials for the year 2025.

title: Dr. Shafi acquitted from all charges
byline: Specialist Dr. Shafi Sihabdeen has been acquitted from all charges by the Kurunegala Magistrate’s Court, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Govt to utilise unspent 2024 funds to clear road project debt
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has green-lighted the management of unused allocations for 2024 to settle the outstanding bills under the 100,000 km road rehabilitation program.

title: ‘No more queues for passports’: Minister on new online token system
byline: Cabinet Spokesperson Minister Vijitha Herath says that the online system to reserve a date for obtaining passports is currently in operation effective from midnight yesterday (05).

title: Ex-president CBK’s security remains unchanged, Minister assures
byline: Minister Vijitha Herath states that the security detail of former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga has neither been removed nor reduced.

title: Four ex-Customs officers sentenced to 35 years RI over bribery charges
byline: The Colombo High Court has sentenced four former officials of Sri Lanka Customs to 35 years of rigorous imprisonment each after they were found guilty of the charges of accepting a bribe of Rs. 125 million in 2015 to release bus spare parts imported for the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB).

title: Republicans win control of US Senate, make gains in House
byline: Republicans won control of the U.S. Senate with victories in West Virginia and Ohio on Tuesday, ensuring Donald Trump’s party will control at least one chamber of Congress next year.

title: Trump claims victory after Fox News projects he has won US presidency
byline: Republican Donald Trump claimed victory in the 2024 presidential contest after Fox News projected that he had defeated Democrat Kamala Harris, which would cap a stunning political comeback four years after he left the White House.

title: ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ is for human-centered governance - Dilith Jayaweera
byline: The leader of the ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ alliance, Gampaha District parliamentary candidate, entrepreneur Dilith Jayaweera emphasized his party’s commitment to establishing a populist political movement aimed at transforming Sri Lanka’s political landscape.

title: Recalled political appointees in foreign service set deadline to return
byline: Sri Lanka’s Cabinet Spokesman and Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath says that certain officials appointed to the country’s Foreign Service on a political basis have been instructed to return to the island by December 01.

title: Three arrested over murder of Kempitiya Walawwa owner
byline: Three individuals, including the wife of a wealthy businessman, have been arrested in connection with the murder of the owner of Kempitiya Walawwa in Kegalle.

title: Court orders to probe false report on President published online during election
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (06) ordered the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to carry out a full investigation into a false report published on the internet regarding the incumbent President during the recent presidential election.

title: Court to review injunction against e-passport purchase; Ex-President Ranil named respondent
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has been named as a respondent of the writ petition filed with the Court of Appeal challenging the previous government’s decision to purchase passports from two foreign companies.

title: PM meets ICC anti-corruption chiefs, discuss advancing integrity in cricket
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya recently met with key figures from the International Cricket Council (ICC) Anti-Corruption Unit (ACU), including Mr. Sumathi Dharmawardena, President’s Counsel and the newly appointed Independent Chair of the ICC’s ACU and Mr. Alex Marshall, General Manager of the ICC Integrity Unit.

title: Donald Trump elected president in stunning comeback
byline: Donald Trump was elected president, capping a remarkable comeback four years after he was voted out of the White House and ushering in a new American leadership likely to test democratic institutions at home and relations abroad.

title: Bitcoin leaps to record high as traders lean towards Trump victory
byline: Bitcoin surged to a record high in Asian trade as investors leaned towards Donald Trump winning the U.S. presidential election.

title: Landslide early warnings for 8 districts extended
byline: The National Building and Research Organisation (NBRO) has extended the early landslide warnings issued to multiple areas in eight districts, as heavy rainfall continues in parts of the island.

title: President Dissanayake congratulates Trump, eyes stronger ties
byline: Sri Lanka’s President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has congratulated the President-elect of the United States Donald Trump.

title: Russia’s Azur Air resumes winter flights to Sri Lanka
byline: Russia’s Azur Air has officially resumed its seasonal winter flights to Sri Lanka, with the first flight arriving at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake today (Nov. 06).
